pageContent: Background: Treatment of metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) has evolved rapidly. In particular, five new treatments that extend survival in mCRPC have been approved since 2010, including the chemotherapy cabazitaxel (Jevtana®), hormonal agents abiraterone (Zytiga®) and enzalutamide (Xtandi®), vaccine sipuleucel-T (Provenge®), and radiopharmaceutical radium-223 (Xofigo®); all have different indications and toxicity profiles.

metaData.source:
Genome-wide analysis of androgen receptor binding and gene regulation in two CWR22-derived prostate cancer cell lines
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20634343/
